website_summaries.verdict: If you’re looking for a rugged-looking pair of indoor bike shoes, check out the Pearl Izumi X-Road Fuel v5. It is equipped with an outsole that has an aggressive tread pattern for use on various types of surfaces. It is built to be sturdy to make pedaling less strenuous on the leg muscles. It has also been praised for its snug yet comfortable fit, making it a top pick for many riders.
pros: Almost all of the users regard the Pearl Izumi X-Road Fuel v5 as comfortable for daily use
The rigid outsole delivers effective power transfer, says a good number of people
A bunch of cyclists appreciate the extra room in the front as their toes don’t feel squished
Multiple owners like the versatility of this cycling trainer because it can be used for indoor spinning, road, and mountain trails
Despite the bulky appearance, several reviewers are impressed with how light this footgear is
The skate-shoe style of this product resonates well with numerous purchasers
cons: Some individuals find the X-Road Fuel v5 to be too stiff for walking
According to a few folks, this footgear is a bit pricey, considering it doesn’t have any specialized closing mechanism

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, but at full price it is hard to see what sets them apart from other similar shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Being up front, I got these through warehouse deals for a very good discount. For the money I spent these are 5 stars all day. However at full retail price they are a good, but average cycling shoe. If I could give half stars I would say these are 3.5, not bad, but not great. These are geared for casual cyclists, or cyclists who want a casual look. On that note they hit the mark, walking in them is easy, they look like normal shoes. They are also lighter than other casual SPD style shoes. However if I had to pay full price... there are better options for less then the $110 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Dpars

customer_reviews.title: I used these for a ride from Oregon to Massachusetts.
customer_reviews.text: They worked perfectly. I have size 15 (US) feet and it is difficult to find a decent shoe. These were perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Spent the extra money and it was worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Spent the extra money and it was worth it. The previous reviews said that it would fit comfortably accurately and you can walk on it without the clicking sound. I found all of these things to be spot on.! Would highly recommend spending a little extra money to get the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: 5 star shoe but bad sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great shoe and great looking. I got it for indoor spinning and so I could walk around the house / go to the store etc in comfort. I only ding the product because the sizing chart is way off. I’m a 12 1/2 and anything smaller than a 48 would not work.
customer_reviews.author: cjb

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: On the positive side, these are very comfortable shoes. They lost a star because parts of the sole started to come unglued after a very short time - these pieces don’t affect the overall function of the shoe, and aren’t structural, but they shouldn’t be coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: made for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: the product is good but only good for narrow feet
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Wow, finally for those with wide feet. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: This is right on the money. I have a wide feet and all MTB shoes for wide feet runs about $180-$300, when I saw this one and saw one guy said that he has wide feet too and worked for him, I ordered it! And Bam! Love it so much. Can’t wait to ride em.
customer_reviews.author: Tabasa

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, doesn't look bad at all, comfortable and easy to walk around in.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I have used
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I have used in a while. Easy to walk with, look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Aero

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe with a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Stylish looking shoe that fit very well. Very comfortable to walk and ride in. Looks to be well built and lighter than your standard tennis shoe. Clips are recessed nicely but I wouldn’t walk across tile or hardwood floors with them. Overall, I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Evdog

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Shoes ! Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, they fit perfectly , look great , are comfortable. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rupple

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these, they don’t look like traditional spin shoes.
customer_reviews.author: April L Heath

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bicycle lock-in-pedal shoe you can walk in
customer_reviews.text: Shoe works as advertised. Very comfortable. Light-weight. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a wider toe box and this shoe fits well. I based my purchase on other reviews that indicated they fit a wide foot. I am planning on using these on the Great Divide bike route next summer and think these will work perfectly. Have done several 30 plus mile rides with them and they are great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Ok bike shoes
customer_reviews.text: They looked ok, just a little clunky. Has to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10E and bout the 45 which fits perfectly. Only downside, I wish the shoes had a velcro strap.
customer_reviews.author: Egor

customer_reviews.title: Great looking & feeling shoe for those on & off the bike
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I’ve had them for over a month now and I am on & off the bike all day. Many days, I wear them all day on and off the bike they’re very comfortable despite all the walking I do. There is no clicking from the cleats when you walk. After a month, they are still very firm.
customer_reviews.author: Janssen Redcay

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes! They were everything I expected them to be. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes - Have done several 50 mile plus rides. Comfortable with no rubbing.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe but too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe but had to return due to being too narrow for my feet
customer_reviews.author: Jidaa

customer_reviews.title: Good price and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice spin shoe and great price. Gets my husband on the bike so 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: susan granger

customer_reviews.title: Bike shoes
customer_reviews.text: Decent bicycle sure that can be worn walking around and also riding the bike. A good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Fess  Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit as my cycling shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are exactly what I expected. They are a perfect fit, comfortable and stylish. A shoe that can be worn around as a casual shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn James

customer_reviews.title: Good value shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe at a reasonable price for fitness riders and others.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G. Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Good overall bike shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable shoe. Fits in between a road and MTB shoe
customer_reviews.author: J. Armbrust

customer_reviews.title: look like they're made of good material
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly, and I have fat feet, look like they're made of good material!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Narrow but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the red X-Road Fuel V5 in 44M EUR and I normally wear 9W shoes. They width on the larger shoes is adequate but the heel is a little loose and it's a little long in the toe area--so it does run narrow. On the other hand, it is surprisingly comfortable to walk around in, with my rides often requiring walking up a steep hill for a few minutes. I purchased them directly from Pearl Izumi which had them for $82.50 with free shipping vs. Amazon's $110.
customer_reviews.author: 982500h

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not for flat peddles
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits my wide foot well and has nice protection of the toe box. This is a good for a clipless shoes, but is not suitable for flat peddles. When I run with the cleat delete plate the hard plastic gets in the way and will not allow the rubbers sole to engage the pins on the flat peddle. Then the rubber sole has started to rip off the bottom and does not have enough rubber area to grip the pins. Overall, is it a good shoe for clipless but falls way short as a flat peddle shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbitdave

customer_reviews.title: when ordering this item, ask for larger size compare with the one you used to..
customer_reviews.text: very nice shoes. meets perfectlly my needs with my riding style (mountain ride + bit of walk etc.) unfortuantly, the size is too small, as i usually wear a 39-40 eur - but this pair is more like 37-38 eur.
customer_reviews.author: Itay O

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great feel.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Sidi cycling road shoes for many years. Just bought these as a substitute on hot ride days. I love the extra room I can get by loosening the laces and how great they feel riding and walking. They have a quality feel at 1/3 the price of my Italian made Sidi’s. Look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: These were a little snug so I'm going to order the next size up.
customer_reviews.text: I will write a review when I ride in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

product_meta.title: PEARL IZUMI Men's X-Road Fuel V5 Cycling Shoe
product_meta.description: At home on the bike, at the gym or around town, the Men's X-Road Fuel v5 delivers pedaling performance and easy off-the-bike walk-ability.
feature_bullets: Bonded Seamless Upper delivers all-day riding comfort and durability
Low-cut construction for a light, fast fit and feel
Built in lace garage eliminates drivetrain interference
X-Road nylon plate delivers great pedaling stability, power and efficiency with off-the-bike comfort and walk-ability (stiffness rating 4)
